a Path object denoting the created path

                               int nodes)

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the cycle
nodes - the number of nodes that the created cycle will have
Returns:
a Path object denoting the created cycle. Its first node will also be its last node

Creates a grid with the specified number of rows and columns.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the cycle
nodesPerDimension - how many nodes to create for each dimension (the number of dimensions is the number of the int arguments)

                                    int... nodesPerDimension)
Creates a grid with the specified number of rows and columns, which folds around and connects back to itself.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the cycle
nodesPerDimension - how many nodes to create for each dimension (the number of dimensions is the number of the int arguments)

createSmallWorld_Kleinberg

public static void createSmallWorld_Kleinberg(Graph g,
                                              int gridSize,
                                              double clusteringExponent)
Constructs a random graph with small world properties. Graph generator that produces a random graph with small world properties. The underlying model is an [gridSize]x[gridSize] toroidal grid. Each node u has four local connections, one to each of its neighbors, and in addition one long range connection to some randomly chosen v according to probability proportional to d^(-clusteringExponent) where d is the lattice distance between u and v.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
gridSize - the grid size (length of row or column dimension)
clusteringExponent - the clustering exponent parameter (somewhere around 2 is a good choice)
See Also:
"Navigation in a small world J. Kleinberg, Nature 406(2000), 845."

createSmallWorld_Kleinberg

public static void createSmallWorld_Kleinberg(Graph g,
                                              Random random,
                                              int gridSize,
                                              double clusteringExponent)
Constructs a random graph with small world properties, based on Kleinberg's algorithm. Graph generator that produces a random graph with small world properties. The underlying model is an [gridSize]x[gridSize] toroidal grid. Each node u has four local connections, one to each of its neighbors, and in addition one long range connection to some randomly chosen v according to probability proportional to d^(-clusteringExponent) where d is the lattice distance between u and v.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
random - the random number generator to use
gridSize - the grid size (length of row or column dimension)
clusteringExponent - the clustering exponent parameter (somewhere around 2 is a good choice)
See Also:
"Navigation in a small world J. Kleinberg, Nature 406(2000), 845."

createSmallWorld_Watts

public static void createSmallWorld_Watts(Graph g,
                                          int nodes,
                                          int k,
                                          double p)
Constructs a random graph with small world properties, based on Watts/Strogatz algorithm. A beta-model is used as proposed by Duncan Watts. The basic ideas is to start with a one-dimensional ring lattice in which each node has k-neighbors and then randomly rewire the edges, with probability p, in such a way that a small world networks can be created for certain values of p and k that exhibit low characteristic path lengths and high clustering coefficient.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
nodes - the number of nodes to create
k - the number of neighbors for each node, in the generated ring lattice
p - the probability of an edge rewiring
See Also:
"Small Worlds:The Dynamics of Networks between Order and Randomness by D.J. Watts"

createSmallWorld_Watts

public static void createSmallWorld_Watts(Graph g,
                                          Random random,
                                          int nodes,
                                          int k,
                                          double p)
Constructs a random graph with small world properties, based on Watts/Strogatz algorithm. A beta-model is used as proposed by Duncan Watts. The basic ideas is to start with a one-dimensional ring lattice in which each node has k-neighbors and then randomly rewire the edges, with probability p, in such a way that a small world networks can be created for certain values of p and k that exhibit low characteristic path lengths and high clustering coefficient.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
random - the random number generator to use
nodes - the number of nodes to create
k - the number of neighbors for each node, in the generated ring lattice
p - the probability of an edge rewiring
See Also:
"Small Worlds:The Dynamics of Networks between Order and Randomness by D.J. Watts"

                                     int nodes,
                                     int neighbors)
Creates a ring lattice.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
nodes - the number of nodes to create
neighbors - the number of (outgoing) neighbors of each node

createRandom

public static void createRandom(Graph g,
                                int nodes,
                                double p)
Creates a random graph, using Erdos-Renyi algorithm.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
nodes - the number of nodes to generate
p - the probability (0 >= p >= 1) that, for any pair of nodes, an edge between them should be created

createRandom

public static void createRandom(Graph g,
                                Random random,
                                int nodes,
                                double p)
Creates a random graph, using Erdos-Renyi algorithm.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
random - the random number generator to use
nodes - the number of nodes to generate
p - the probability (0 >= p >= 1) that, for any pair of nodes, an edge between them should be created

createRandomTree

public static Node createRandomTree(Graph g,
                                    int nodes,
                                    Direction directionFromRoot)
Creates a random tree with specified number of nodes.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the tree
nodes - the number of nodes the produced tree will have
directionFromRoot - Direction.OUT creates edges from the root towards to the leaves; Direction.IN creates edges from the leaves to the root; Direction.EITHER creates both pairs of edges.
Returns:
the root of the generated tree, or null if nodes == 0

createRandomTree

                                    Random random,
                                    int nodes,
                                    Direction directionFromRoot)
Creates a random tree with specified number of nodes.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the tree
random - the random number generator to use
nodes - the number of nodes the produced tree will have
directionFromRoot - Direction.OUT creates edges from the root towards to the leaves; Direction.IN creates edges from the leaves to the root; Direction.EITHER creates both pairs of edges.
Returns:
the root of the generated tree, or null if nodes == 0

createRandomBiconnectedGraph

public static void createRandomBiconnectedGraph(Graph g,
                                                int nodes)
Creates a random biconnected graph. It starts by with creating a random tree, and connects all leaf nodes to the root.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the biconnected graph
nodes - the number of nodes the produced biconnected graph will have

createRandomBiconnectedGraph

public static void createRandomBiconnectedGraph(Graph g,
                                                Random random,
                                                int nodes)
Creates a random biconnected graph. It starts by with creating a random tree, and further connects all leaf nodes plus the root with a single simple path, thus there are always exactly two node-disjoint paths connecting any pair of nodes: a path following tree edges, and a path through the leaf connections.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the biconnected graph
random - the random number generator to use
nodes - the number of nodes the produced biconnected graph will have

createRandomDag

public static void createRandomDag(Graph g,
                                   int nodes,
                                   double p)
Creates a random dag, using Erdos-Renyi algorithm, while making sure that no cycle exists. The edges can be less than a call to createRandom(Graph, Random, int, double) would generate.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
nodes - the number of nodes to generate
p - the probability (0 >= p >= 1) that, for any pair of nodes, an edge between them should be created.

createRandomDag

public static void createRandomDag(Graph g,
                                   Random random,
                                   int nodes,
                                   double p)
Creates a random dag, using Erdos-Renyi algorithm, while making sure that no cycle exists. The edges can be less than a call to createRandom(Graph, Random, int, double) would generate.

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
random - the random number generator to use
nodes - the number of nodes to generate
p - the probability (0 >= p >= 1) that, for any pair of nodes, an edge between them should be created.

createGeneral

public static void createGeneral(Graph g,
                                 int... nodeDegreeDistribution)
Creates a graph that tries to honor the specified degree distribution. The degree distribution must be graphical, as defined in Graphs#isSequenceGraphical(int[]).

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
nodeDegreeDistribution - the distribution of node degrees, which must be graphical
See Also:
Graphs#isSequenceGraphical(int[])

createGeneral

public static void createGeneral(Graph g,
                                 Random random,
                                 int... nodeDegreeDistribution)
Creates a graph that tries to honor the specified degree distribution. The degree distribution must be graphical, as defined in Graphs#isSequenceGraphical(int[]).

Parameters:
g - the graph object in which to create the graph
random - the random number generator to use
nodeDegreeDistribution - the distribution of node degrees, which must be graphical
See Also:
Graphs#isSequenceGraphical(int[])
